modules.description: Handles database schema migrations by providing pre-defined SQL commands for initializing and modifying tables. Works with string lists to represent sequences of SQL statements. Used to upgrade or downgrade specific database tables by generating the appropriate SQL commands based on the target schema version.

This module connects to and manages PostgreSQL databases, supporting SQL execution, transaction control, and schema migrations. It handles database creation, versioned migrations, and parameterized queries, with main data types including connection handles and transaction objects. Its migration submodule applies versioned schema changes using SQL command sequences, enabling safe upgrades and downgrades. Example uses include initializing schemas, running transactions with commit or rollback, and applying migration scripts to evolve database structure.

Handles database schema migrations with explicit version control. Applies upgrade functions or downgrades when given a target version, using versioned SQL scripts. Useful for managing incremental changes to a PostgreSQL database structure in deployment pipelines.
